description: Inverse Mertens function: smallest k such that |M(k)| = n, where M(x) is Mertens' function A002321
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
maple: with(numtheory): k := 0: s := 0: for n from 1 to 20000 do s := s+mobius(n): if abs(s) > k then k := abs(s): print(n); fi; od:
mathematica: a = s = 0; Do[s = s + MoebiusMu[n]; If[ Abs[s] > a, a = Abs[s]; Print[n]], {n, 1, 20000}]
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (elemIndex)import Data.Maybe (fromJust)a051402 = (+ 1) . fromJust . (`elemIndex` ms) where   ms = map (abs . a002321) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 26 2012
crossrefs: Essentially same as A060434 except for initial terms.
author: _Jud McCranie_
